verbose_text: 13 Vitamin D induces apoptosis through down-regulation of the antiapoptotic protein B-cell lymphoma 2 (BCL2), 13 inhibits the expression of P-cadherin 14 and increases the expression E-cadherin, 15 which may contribute to the anti-invasive or antimetastatic effects of vitamin D. Further, vitamin D induces the expression of the tumor suppressor BRCA1, because the binding sites for the vitamin D/VDR/retinoid X receptor heterodimer complex are present within the BRCA1 promoter region.
evidence: expression of the tumor suppressor BRCA1
